messages.content: "According to Rudyard Kipling what were the ""two imposters"" to meet and treat the same day?"?

response:
According to Rudyard Kipling, the "two impostors" are **Triumph and Disaster**.

This reference comes from his famous poem **"If—"**, specifically the lines:

> "If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster  
> And treat those two impostors just the same;"

Kipling advises that both success (Triumph) and failure (Disaster) are "impostors"—they are fleeting and not to be taken too seriously. One should treat both with equanimity.
